info.title: Cloud Backup Service REST API Reference
info.description:
Overview

Cloud Backup is a service embedded within the Cloud Manager platform that provides backup and restore capabilities for protection and long-term archiving of your data residing in Cloud Volumes ONTAP and on-premises ONTAP clusters (AFF/FAS/OTS). By using this service, you can automatically generate and store backups in an object store in the public or private cloud account of your choice, and you can easily restore data anytime and to any location, as per your requirements.

There are seven categories of endpoints defined within the Cloud Backup service.

  • backup
  • catalog
  • cloud
  • job
  • license
  • restore
  • single file-level restore (SFR)
  • working environment

REST implementation

HTTP methods

MethodDescription
POSTCreate an object instance
GETRetrieve an object instance or collection
PATCHUpdate an existing object
DELETERemove an existing object

Request headers

Request HeaderDescription
AuthorizationRequired. Contains the JWT access token
x-agent-idRequired. Contains the Cloud Manager Connector ID.
x-netapp-cache-controlUsing this header would bypass local cache and retrieve actual data from upstream sources like Cloud Manager SaaS application and ONTAP clusters.

Query parameters

You can use query parameters with endpoints in the following components:

ComponentQuery Parameter
sfraccountId(required),
volumeId,
snapshotId.
backupaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId.
restoreaccountId(required).
Working environmentaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId.
cloudaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId,
volumeId,
snapshotId,awsAccountId,
regionCode,
subscriptionId,
vaultName,
projectId,
jobId.
licenseaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId.
catalogaccountId(required),
workingEnvironmentId.
jobaccountId(required),
jobId.

Response headers

This API uses the standard HTTP response headers common with all Cloud Manager APIs. See REST implementation for more information.

HTTP status codes

HTTP Status CodeDescription
200OK:Returned for successful operation completion
400Bad Request:Returned if the input is malformed and could not be parsed
401Unauthorized:Returned if user authentication failed or the token has expired
403Forbidden:Returned for authorization errors depending on the resource and token
Error handling

There are two processes involved with error handling and processing.

  • The error is logged for supportability
  • The error is also returned to the caller for any specific handling
cURL examples

Retrieve specific volume details

This example retrieves the details of a specific volume that has been backed up using Cloud Backup Service.

curl -X GET "https://cloudmanager.cloud.netapp.com/account/(account_id)/providers/cloudmanager_cbs/api/v1/backup/working-environment/(working_environment_id)/volume/(volume_id)" -H "accept: application/json" -H "authorization: (user token)"
Frequently asked questions

There are multiple versions of the same command. Which version should I use?

If there are multiple versions of the same API endpoint, make sure to use the latest version of the API. The version of each endpoint is mentioned in the path.

Whatâ€™s the difference between user token and service token and why do we need two types of token authorization ?

A user token is used for communication between a user (or the UI) and the Cloud Manager REST APIs, whereas the service token is used for communication between two services (machine-to-machine interaction) in the Cloud Manager platform. The type of token required to invoke an API is documented in the description of each endpoint.

What is difference between SFR Cloud Backup APIs and Catalog Cloud Backup APIs?

The SFR Cloud Backup APIs provide the option to use the "Browse and Restore" feature while performing a volume level or single/multiple files restore operation from backups stored on the cloud.The Catalog Cloud Backup APIs have introduced a new "Search and Restore" feature, which enables you to search for a specific file from all backups stored on Amazon S3 cloud storage and then perform a restore operation. It enables you to perform a quick and focused search for files across all the backups in the cloud and gives you the option to narrow down the searches by using multiple search criteria.

post.description:
Starts a file explore operation while initiating a single file restore (SFR) operation. This API endpoint implements single or multiple file restore operations that work on "default" and "compliance" integration modes. This API endpoint is currently supported on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on Amazon Web Service (AWS), Cloud Volumes ONTAP on Azure, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It supports retrieving files from AWS, Azure, and StorageGRID cloud storage providers. The API endpoint initiates the deployment of the additional cloud restore instance. It initiates a cloud formation template in AWS or resource operation template in Azure, depending on the cloud provider. If the cloud restore instance is already deployed and offline, the endpoint restarts the cloud restore instance.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Returns the file explore status when you initiate a single or multiple file restore operation. This API endpoint also returns the deployment status of an Active Data Connector (ADC) container on the cloud restore instance during the restore process and the overall status of the file listing operation.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Returns the file explore status when you initiate a single or multiple file restore operation. This API endpoint also returns the deployment status of an Active Data Connector (ADC) container on the cloud restore instance during the restore process and the overall status of the file listing operation.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of the files contained in the specified volume Snapshot copy for a single or multiple file restore operation. The volume Snapshot copy is mounted on the cloud restore instance to create a file catalog for the "Browse and Restore" option.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of the files within a specified volume Snapshot copy in a paginated fashion during a single or multiple file restore operation (V2 version of the file-explore/list API). You can pass the number of pages and the limit of the number of files that the API endpoint should retrieve while fetching the details in a paginated format. The volume Snapshot copy is mounted on the cloud restore instance to create a file catalog for the "Browse and Restore" option.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Exports a file system from the volume on to the Cloud Restore instance to browse the files for a single/multiple file restores. This API verifies if ADC container is deployed and makes sure that it creates a file catalog for the Browse and Restore option by exporting the file system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Unexports a file system from the cloud restore instance that was mounted to browse the files from a volume for a single or multiple file-restore operation. This API endpoint is called to remove the data fetched during an export after completing a single or multiple file-restore.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of the working environments that are backed up by using Cloud Backup service within an account. This endpoint is routed through the SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves the details of a specific working environment backed up by using Cloud Backup service within an account. This API endpoint is routed through the SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables the Cloud Backup service for a particular working environment. The API endpoint enables the Cloud Backup service on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks and retrieves the storage account details that have been created for a specified account of the selected cloud provider. If a S3 object store storage bucket does not exist, it will create a bucket. It then configures the object store in ONTAP and also creates a SnapMirror policy, if the chosen SnapMirror policy does not exist.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: required when the provider is AWS for On-premises usecase

resource-group.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

storage-account.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

subscription.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

project-id.description: required when the provider is Google Cloud for On-premises usecase

provider.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

storage-server.description: Storage Grid server URL.Required input field in case of SGWS(storage grid) provider

ip-space.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

access-key.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

secret-password.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

put.description:
Modifies the Cloud Backup service for a working environment. You can modify the state and backup policy name.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Modifes all the SnapMirror relationships state in the working envrionment to the state specified

backup-policy-name.description: Policy name of the existing policy

parameters.description: Working Environment ID of the source CVO
parameters.name: workingEnvironmentId

delete.description:
Unregisters a working environment. You can remove the Cloud Backup service from a working environment. Note that before you unregister, make sure you delete all backups and disable the Cloud Backup service on a working environment. This action will also delete the backup folder.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves the backup status of a specified working environment backed up by using the Cloud Backup service within an account. This API endpoint is routed through the Cloud Manager SaaS interface to retrieve the details of a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables the Cloud Backup service for a specified working environment synchronously (V2 version). This endpoint enables the Cloud Backup service on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks and retrieves storage account details that has been created for a specified account on the selected cloud provider. If an S3 object store bucket does not exist, it will create the bucket. It then configures object store on ONTAP and also creates a SnapMirror policy if the chosen SnapMirror policy does not exist.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: required when the provider is AWS for On-premises usecase

resource-group.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

storage-account.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

subscription.description: required when the provider is Azure for On-premises usecase

project-id.description: required when the provider is GCP for On-premises usecase

provider.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

storage-server.description: Storage Grid server URL.Required input field in case of SGWS(storage grid) provider

ip-space.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

access-key.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

secret-password.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

put.description:
Modifies the Cloud Backup service backup configuration for a particular working environment synchronously (V2 version). You can modify the state, backup policy, archive storage class, and enable auto backup.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Modifes all the SnapMirror relationships state in the working envrionment to the state specified

backup-policy.description: Uses an existing policy or Creates a new policy if not found in the list of ONTAP policies and modifies the backed up working environment relationships to use the existing

name.description: Policy name of the existing policy or any custom name with which a new policy needs to be created.If not specified, a policy with Cloud Backup Service default naming convention will be created.

rule.description: Specify the rules for new policy.

archive-storage-class.description: Required for AWS if modifying the storage class or enabling archive for the first time

parameters.description: Working Environment ID of the source CVO
parameters.name: workingEnvironmentId

post.description:
Enables the Cloud Backup service for a specific working environment.The V3 version of the API endpoint enables the Cloud Backup service on Cloud Volumes ONTAP on AWS, Azure and Google Cloud and on-premises ONTAP systems. It checks if an S3 cloud storage bucket is associated with an account. If a bucket does not exist, it will create the bucket. It creates a backup folder on the S3 cloud object storage bucket in the specified cloud provider or StorageGRID. The ability to tier older backup files to archival storage requires that the cluster is running ONTAP 9.10.1 or later version (supported currently with AWS and Azure). Restoring volumes from backup objects that reside in archival storage also requires that the destination cluster is running ONTAP 9.10.1 or later version.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

account-id.description: Required when the provider is AWS

access-key.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

secret-password.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

kms-key-id.description: Optional input field for customer managed key usecase

id.description: optional input field for private endpoint

archive-storage-class.description: Required for AWS to specify which storage class to be used for archival

resource-group.description: required when the provider is Azure

storage-account.description: required when the provider is Azure

subscription.description: required when the provider is Azure

private-endpoint.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase for private link configuration

subnet.description: Required input field for On-premises private link configuration

project-id.description: required when the provider is Google Cloud

access-key.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

secret-password.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

storage-server.description: Storage Grid server URL.Required input field in case of SGWS(storage grid) provider

access-key.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

secret-password.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

ip-space.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume. Backup is not allowed for volume enabled with SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure optional backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an ad-hoc Snapshot copy and creates a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copy as per ONTAP snapshot policy and creates a backup to the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, the API endpoint will create a SnapMirror to Cloud relationship with the the specific cloud object storage.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates a ad-hoc snapshot and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates snapshots as per ONTAP snapshot policy and backs it up to the cloud as per the backup policy. [Deprecated] IMMEDIATE mode designed for internal usecase and not to be used for newer integrations

get.description:
Retrieves information of a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup Service. It retrieves the details of the volume from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. It retrieves backup status, relationship policy name, and details.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Modifies a specified backed up volume. You can use this API endpoint to modify the volume state, backup policy, backup policy rule-retention and archive-after-days parameters.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Removes the backup settings on a specified backed up volume. To remove the backup from the volume, the Snapshot copies taken for the volume must be deleted.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume (version 2). Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per ONTAP Snapshot copy policy and stores a backup to the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates a ad-hoc Snapshot copy and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates Snapshot copy as per ONTAP snapshot policy and backs it up to the cloud as per the backup policy. [Deprecated] IMMEDIATE mode designed for internal usecase and not to be used for newer integrations

post.description:
Enables backup for a specified volume (version 3). This version of the endpoint runs the job asynchronously. Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per ONTAP Snapshot copy policy and stores a backup to the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

mode.description: AD_HOC mode creates a on-demand Snapshot copy and backs it up on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode creates Snapshot copies as per ONTAP snapshot policy and backs it up to the cloud as per the backup policy. [Deprecated] IMMEDIATE mode designed for internal usecase and not to be used for newer integrations

get.description:
Retrieves details of all the volumes for a specified working environment backed up by using the Cloud Backup service. It retrieves the volume name, volume type, protocol, Storage VM, backup status, last backup creation time, Snapshot count, associated backup policy and backup policy rules.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables the backup of multiple volumes. Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a NetApp SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different optional backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud object storage. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copy as per ONTAP Snapshot policy and stores a backup on the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a specific cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Modifies multiple backed-up volumes in a specific working environment. This API endpoint modifies the volume state, backup-policy, backup policy rule and retention, and archive-after-days parameters.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Enables backup for multiple volumes (version 2). Backup is not allowed for a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). You can configure the different backup modes. The AD_HOC mode creates an on-demand Snapshot copy and stores a backup on the respective cloud. SCHEDULED mode (default mode) creates Snapshot copies as per the ONTAP Snapshot policy and stores a backup to the cloud as per the backup policy. Based on the defined backup policy, this API endpoint creates a SnapMirror to cloud relationship with a cloud object storage system.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves information of a Snapshot copy for a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup service for a working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the details of the volume Snapshot copies from the Cloud manager SaaS application. It retrieves the Snapshot name, Snapshot creation time, archive status, and size.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Deletes a specified snapshot for a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup service for a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

get.description:
Retrieves snapshot information for a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup service for a working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the details of the volume snapshots from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. It retrieves the Snapshot name, Snapshot creation time, archive status, and size.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

delete.description:
Deletes all the snapshots for a specified volume backed up by using the Cloud Backup service for a working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Deletes all the snapshots for a specified working environment backed up by using the Cloud Backup service (V2 version).

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Performs a volume and file-level restore operation. This API endpoint validates whether a backup of a volume exists. Restore is not supported on DP volumes. A restore operation is not supported on a target volume with a different language code than the source volume. A restore operation is not supported for volumes with a size less than 1 GB. Restore is not allowed on a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). It checks whether the source and target cloud provider matches. It also verifies whether the backup and restore operation is supported in the specified working environments.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Performs a volume and file level restore (version 2) operation. This API validates whether a backup of a volume exists. A restore operation is not supported on DP volumes. A restore operation is not supported on a target volume with a different language code than the source volume. Restore operation is not supported for volumes with a size less than 1 GB. A restore operation is not allowed on a volume enabled with a SnapLock license (WORM license). It checks whether the source and target cloud provider matches. It also verifies whether the backup and restore operation is supported in the working environments.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

archive-restore-priority.description: Required to specify the archival retrieval priority to determine the restoration time.

get.description:
Retrieves the status of the volume and file level restore operation. This API endpoint tracks the restore job and retrieves the job status, error, time, and details of the restore job.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of ONTAP backup policies associated with a working environment. You can filter the policies based on the archival enablement status. This API endpoint retrieves the backup-policy name, rule, attached volume count, and archive-after-days information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: To filter the policies based on the archival enablement status
parameters.name: archived

post.description:
Creates a backup policy in a working environment. The number of retained backups can be up to a maximum of 1018 when no backup policies are assigned to the volume. You can edit a policy to create up to 4000 backups after you assign volumes to a policy through ONTAP CLI. This API endpoint validates whether the ONTAP version used by a working environment supports archiving.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Updates a backup policy in a working environment. This API endpoint modifies the rule, label-rule, retention, and archive-after-days information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

archive-after-days.description: Archive after days value to which the policy will be modified. "never" implies removal of archive-after-days property from a backup policy

get.description:
Retrieves a list of IP spaces within a specified working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of working environments and their details. This API endpoint retrieves the name, region, status, type, cloud-provider, provider-accountId, ontap-version, and total-volumes-count information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider-account-id.description: AWS account ID/ Azure subscription ID / GCP project ID

get.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the name, region, status, type, cloud-provider, provider-accountId, ontap-version, and total-volumes-count of a specific working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

provider-account-id.description: AWS account ID/ Azure subscription ID / GCP project ID

get.description:
Retrieves a list of Storage VMs and their details from a specific working environment. This API retrieves the ID, name, and aggregate list that belongs to a Storage VM.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of volumes and their details from a specific working environment. This API endpoint retrieves the name, file-system-id, status , Storage VM, type, style, capacity allocated , capacity used, and SnapMirror label information.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Configures object storage. Verifies whether a private endpoint is enabled and a certificate is installed. This API endpoint is called if no object stores are found when Cloud Backup service is enabled.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Configures object storage. This is v2 version of the object store configure API. Verifies whether a private endpoint is enabled and a certificate is installed. This API endpoint is called if no object stores are found when Cloud Backup service is enabled.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

account-id.description: required when the provider is AWS

id.description: optional input field for private endpoint

subscription.description: required when the provider is Azure

private-endpoint.description: Required input field for On-premises usecase for private link configuration

subnet.description: Required input field for On-premises private link configuration

get.description:
Retrieves a list of working environment volume directories. You can query by using target Storage VM and path of directories to browse within the volume.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Path of directories to browse within volume
parameters.name: path

get.description:
Retrieves an object store configuration status. It uses the GET /api/cloud/targets ONTAP REST APIs to retrieve the details.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS accounts from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of subscribed AWS regions from Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS keys from a specified region that belongs to a specified AWS account ID from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS private links from a specified region that belongs to a specified AWS account ID from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of AWS storage classes for archival support from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of regions from a specific subscription ID in Azure from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

post.description:
Creates Azure resource group in the specified subscription ID.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

name.description: Name of the resource group to be created

region.description: Region where resource group needs to be created

get.description:
Retrieves a list of Azure resource groups from a specific subscription ID in Azure from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure virtual networks from a specific subscription ID in Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure subscriptions for a particular account from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure vault keys from a particular vault for a specific subscription ID in the Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Azure vault for a specific subscription ID in Azure cloud from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Google Cloud projects from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of regions from a specific Google Cloud project from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of jobs from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. You can query based on the job type and job status from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

data.description: Optional object present in case of batch / individual operations inside the main job only

multi-volume-backup.description: contains individual volume data for multi-volume-backup

volume.description: Array of objects containing volume backup status/error with the volume id

error.description: error message in case of failure

restore.description: contains information about restore job - file and volume restore

source.description: Optional object containing present only in case of restore operation

target.description: Optional object containing present only in case of restore operation

batch.description: Optional array present only in case of restore files operation

get.description:
Retrieves the details of particular jobs from the Cloud Manager SaaS application.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

data.description: Optional object present in case of batch / individual operations inside the main job only

multi-volume-backup.description: contains individual volume data for multi-volume-backup

volume.description: Array of objects containing volume backup status/error with the volume id

error.description: error message in case of failure

restore.description: contains information about restore job - file and volume restore

source.description: Optional object containing present only in case of restore operation

target.description: Optional object containing present only in case of restore operation

batch.description: Optional array present only in case of restore files operation

post.description:
Configures the service to include indexed cataloging services. This API endpoint initiates the creation of an S3 bucket on an account level for cataloging to store the details of the backup and changes. It also enables the AWS Athena interactive S3 query service and AWS Glue serverless data integration service to coordinate with the new catalog feature.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Searches for a specific file from the backups taken by the Cloud Backup service. It can also search for a specified volume. It is possible to narrow down your file searches based on a particular working environment, file extensions, size ranges, creation date range, and also location of the backup.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

Retrieves a list of Snapshot copies pertaining to a particular volume using the catalog index query.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

put.description:
Enables or disables the indexed cataloging service for a specified working environment.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

state.description: Modifes all the snapmirror relationships state in the working envrionment to the state specified

get.description:
Retrieves the license validity of the working environments from the Cloud Manager SaaS. The API retrieves the eligibility of the current license used and it also returns the days remaining if the user is using a trial license.

Token usage: Cloud Manager user token.

parameters.description: Cloud provider account ID. AWS account ID/Azure subscription ID/ GCP project ID. Need not send this query param for SGWS
parameters.name: cloudProviderAccountId

tags.name: SFR
tags.description:
Overview

The single file restore (SFR) endpoints helps to retrieve files from the volume Snapshot copies.

You can perform the following operations by using the SFR endpoints:

  • Retrieve file explore status.

  • List files during file explore operations.

  • Unexport a file system.

tags.name: Backup
tags.description:
Overview

The backup endpoints manage backup operations of cloud and on-prem resources and retrieve details of the backup data when required.You can perform the following operations by using the Backup endpoints.

  • Retrieve details of the backup data of working environment, volumes and Snapshot copies

  • Enable backups on a working environment, back up volumes, and create on-demand backups

  • Modify the backup configuration of working environments and volumes

  • Disable backups for working environments and volumes, and delete backups

tags.name: Restore
tags.description:
Overview

The restore endpoints enable you to perform volume and file-level restore operations.You can perform the following operations by using the Restore endpoints:

  • Restore volumes and files

  • Retrieve volume and file restore status

tags.name: Working Environment
tags.description:
Overview

The working environment endpoints manage the backup policies and configure an object store associated with a working environment.

You can perform the following operations by using the working environment endpoints:

  • Retrieve the list and details of working environments, backup policies, IP spaces, SVMs, and volumes

  • Create a backup policy and configure an object store

  • List working environment volume directories.

  • Modify a backup policy

tags.name: Cloud
tags.description:
Overview

The Cloud endpoints enable you to retrieve information about various resources of the AWS, Azure, Google Cloud providers from the Cloud Manager platform.

You can perform the following actions by using the Cloud endpoints:

  • Retrieve the accounts, AWS region key, AWS region private-link, AWS archival storage-class, Azure subscription, Azure subscription region, Azure subscription resource-group, Azure subscription vnet, Azure subscription vault key, Google Cloud projects, Google Cloud project region, and so on

  • Create a subscription resource-group

tags.name: Job
tags.description:
Overview

The Job endpoints display information about jobs executed on the Cloud Manager platform.

You can perform the following operation by using the Job endpoints:

  • Retrieve a list of jobs and job details

tags.name: Catalog
tags.description:
Overview

The Catalog endpoints manage the indexed catalog search for files based on a query. You can perform the following opearations by using the Catalog endpoints:

  • Initiate an indexed catalog search based on a query

  • Retrieve a list of Snapshot copies pertaining to a particular volume by using the Catalog Index query

  • Configure an indexed catalog service

  • Modify the state of an indexed catalog service

tags.name: License
tags.description:
Overview

The License endpoints enable you to retrieve the license validity of the working environments from the Cloud Manager SaaS application. A valid license is required to activate Cloud Backup on a working environment, to create backups of your production data, and to restore backup data to a production system. This API retrieves the eligibility of the current license used and it also returns the days remaining if you are using a trial license.
